casebody.data:
PAUL JOYCE, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. JOHN E. STAFFORD AND HELEN R. STAFFORD, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued December 3, 1962 Decided February 18, 1963.

Before Judges Coneoed, Gaulkin and Kilkenny.

Mr. John F. Lahe argued the cause for appellant (Messrs. AiTcen and Lalce, attorneys). Mr. Martin F. Caulfield argued the cause for respondents (Messrs. Hannold and Hannold, attorneys). Per Curiam.

The judgment is affirmed for the reasons stated by Judge R. Cooper Brown in his opinion reported in 72 N. J. Super. 596 (Cty. Ct. 1962).
